meanings.definition: A person who performs magic tricks with skill and dexterity.
meanings.sent1: The children were amazed by the prestidigitators at the circus.
meanings.sent2: The group of prestidigitators amazed the audience with their magic show.
meanings.sent3: The prestidigitators made a coin disappear right before our eyes!
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved like prestidigitators, making the cards vanish effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The prestidigitators' performance was so captivating that no one could look away.

meanings.definition: Those skilled in sleight of hand and illusion.
meanings.sent1: During the magic competition, the prestidigitators showcased their incredible skills.
meanings.sent2: The group of talented prestidigitators amazed the crowd with their tricks.
meanings.sent3: The prestidigitators' tricks were so clever, they left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent4: The prestidigitators' hands moved so fast, it was like watching magic in real life.
meanings.sent5: The audience gasped in amazement at the prestidigitators' flawless performance.
